decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back into play with Animate Dead. To protect the combo pieces, it includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and control options, while Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower offer additional threats. The deck also includes a few lands to disrupt the opponent's mana base, with the goal of overwhelming the opponent with a strong board presence early in the game.

The deck focuses on using efficient spells and creatures to apply pressure on the opponent, disrupting their game plan while controlling the board. It combines aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent with disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze to maintain tempo and protect its threats. The deck also utilizes card selection and filtering with cards like Ponder and Brainstorm to smooth out its draws and ensure consistency in its aggressive game plan.

The main idea of this Legacy Aggro - Dragon Stompy deck is to quickly deploy disruptive threats like Magus of the Moon and Blood Moon to disrupt your opponent's mana base, while also utilizing aggressive creatures like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The deck also includes powerful burn spells like Sundering Eruption and Fury to deal with opposing threats, as well as lock pieces like Chalice of the Void to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive and disruptive to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back to the battlefield for a devastating combo. It also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the game and protect the combo. Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student are key creatures that benefit from this strategy, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help to dig for the combo pieces. The deck also has some flexibility with cards like Brazen Borrower and Force of Negation for additional interaction.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures and then use various spells and abilities to win the game in a single turn. It utilizes cards like Lotus Petal, Dark Ritual, and Simian Spirit Guide to generate mana quickly and cast a large number of spells in one turn. The key strategy is to use cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill the entire deck, before using Thassa's Oracle to win the game by having no cards left in the library. The deck is designed to be fast and explosive, aiming to win before the opponent can react effectively.

The key concept of this deck is to establish control by using cards like Torpor Orb and Dress Down to shut down opponent's creature abilities, while utilizing powerful cards like Phyrexian Dreadnought and Nulldrifter to apply pressure. The deck also focuses on card advantage and manipulation with spells like Brainstorm and Ponder, along with the ability to counter opponent's plays with Force of Will. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student serves as a versatile threat, while the land base provides consistency and mana acceleration. Overall, the deck aims to take control of the game and dictate the tempo.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, before bringing them back with cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The strategy focuses on combining powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier with disruptive spells such as Force of Will and Thoughtseize to overwhelm opponents. The deck also includes cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Brazen Borrower to disrupt opposing strategies and protect its own combo. The overall goal is to create a fast and efficient reanimation engine that can outpace and outmaneuver opponents in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then reanimate them for a game-winning combo. Cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead allow for powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty to be brought back from the graveyard. The deck also includes disruption elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. Overall, this Combo - Reanimator deck aims to overpower opponents with strong creatures brought back from the graveyard while disrupting their game plan.

This combo deck aims to win the game in one turn by milling the entire deck into the graveyard and then using Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the spot. The deck includes cards like Undercity Informer, Balustrade Spy, and lots of fast mana like Lotus Petal, Simian Spirit Guide, and Dark Ritual to achieve this game-winning combo. The deck also includes disruption like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to protect the combo, as well as ways to recur combo pieces like Dread Return and Memory's Journey.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifact cards such as Mystic Forge and Grim Monolith to generate mana and assemble a powerful combination of cards. The goal is to use cards like Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Karn, the Great Creator along with various artifacts to create a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Urza's Tower and Urza's Saga help to further support the combo strategy, with a strong emphasis on utilizing artifacts to gain advantage and control the game.

This Death & Taxes aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan and controlling the board while applying pressure with efficient creatures. It utilizes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to maintain tempo and outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, while also deploying threats like Orcish Bowmasters and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to close out the game quickly. The deck's main goal is to control the pace of the game and overwhelm the opponent with its efficient and disruptive creatures and spells.

This deck focuses on quick and efficient disruption while applying pressure to the opponent's life total. By utilizing cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and control the tempo of the match. Creatures like Brazen Borrower, Nethergoyf, and Barrowgoyf provide a quick clock to pressure the opponent while also providing additional disruption. The deck also utilizes versatile spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for key cards and maintain card advantage. Overall, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent through aggressive disruption and tempo plays in order to secure a victory.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on utilizing cheap, efficient spells and creatures to quickly disrupt the opponent's game plan and deal damage. By including cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, along with cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm, this deck aims to pressure the opponent while maintaining card advantage. The deck also has a disruptive element with cards like Wasteland and Force of Will to control the board and protect its threats. Overall, this deck aims to win the game through a balance of aggression and disruption in the Legacy format.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, and then bring them back onto the battlefield using reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes disruption spells like Daze and Force of Will to protect the combo, as well as card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the necessary pieces. By combining graveyard manipulation with reanimation spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and seize control of the game.

This deck focuses on aggressively controlling the opponent's board through a combination of hand disruption and removal spells. It also utilizes creatures with strong abilities that can provide additional value, such as sacrificing creatures for direct damage or recurring threats. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the deck while also disrupting the opponent's land base through cards like Wasteland. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure while also disrupting the opponent's game plan to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's mana base and board state using powerful disruption cards like Blood Moon, Chalice of the Void, Magus of the Moon, and Sundering Eruption. By locking down the opponent's resources, the deck aims to establish early dominance and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats like Pyrogoyf and Fury. Additionally, cards like Urza's Saga and Chrome Mox provide additional mana sources to accelerate the deck's game plan, while cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker offer additional ways to disrupt the opponent's strategy.
